website_summaries.verdict: With its blend of comfort and features, this nursing bra stands out as the best choice on the market right now for new moms.
pros: New mothers appreciate this bra's many features, including removable cups and fabric that's soft against the skin
This nursing bra also doesn't have uncomfortable underwire
cons: A relatively common complaint is that the cups don't offer enough lift or support

customer_reviews.title: Great bras. Except this time- useless!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth bravado nursing bra. Every single one has been great they've lasted at least six months if not longer this black one however I bought it about six weeks ago I didn't wear it for probably three or four of those weeks and it already is I'm not working the clips area has frayed and I'm outside the return window. For a 50$ bra this is unacceptable. I understand that flaws happen but I guess the lesson is inspect everything with a fine tooth comb within the return window. Ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Leah M

customer_reviews.title: Great nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: I tried on several brands of nursing bras and this was the only one I liked! It's supportive without being restrictive and it both lifts and separates. The clip is easy to use for nursing and it folds completely out of the way. It feels smooth and comfy and doesn't dig in or pinch anywhere. The only con is that this bra is expensive but it's worth the price. I figure three of these bras costs the same as just a few weeks of baby formula! For reference I wear a 36 C or D (fluctuates) and the medium fits perfectly. If you're a 38 you may need next size or an extender since I use last set of hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Walk2345

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I am large chested and couldn’t find a decent nursing bra for pre and post pregnancy. This one fits the bill! It is so comfortable and has great lift and support. I have it in the 2xl for I am a 38G, and it’s perfect. I bought it in black, pink, and tan, and all are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: LiLa

customer_reviews.title: Worst bra ever
customer_reviews.text: This bra is an awful plasticy material. It's completely see-through in white, except for the little circle pads which are very visible in the see-through bra making for an awful look. It feels like putting my breasts in socks, although it didn't look quite that bad. It was not supportive at all. After trying on this bra my husband remarked that people have been making bras for at least a hundred years, how can they still be so very bad at it! While pregnant and nursing my breasts have never been larger or heavier, why are nursing bras made with less support when more is needed?! Stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Athena0911

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. KinderBravely is better!
customer_reviews.text: Fits fine, maybe a little snug. Material is silky feeling. I received this bra Jan 12 and it is already falling apart after just one month of use. I’ve washed it maybe 6-8x. I have dried it even though it says line dry. But after 6x on low heat I feel it should still be holding up better than it is especially at such a high price point. The elastics is starting to do that weird stringy thing. I would not recommend. I ordered two KinderedBravely bras at the same time and have washed/dried those just as much as this one and they are still holding their shape. Go with KinderBravely brand instead, much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: Bulky. Not easy to use. I had to take it off immediately because it took too long before i could singlehandedly undo the snap and feed my baby. The material looked nothing like in the photo. It wasnt the t shirt bra smooth finish that i wanted and expected. Its like a shiny corrugated material that is definitely NOT seamless. It made me look bulky and fat. Ugly bra. Hated it. Especially for the price it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Next
customer_reviews.text: Ordered black and white. I'm 5'4", 100 lbs and the xs fits perfectly. What I Love: the hooks are easy to open and close one handed. What I Don't Love: The fabric looks terrible after one wash, lots of pills everywhere. The white is so thin that the nude color bra pads shows through and look tacky. If you plan on wearing this under something else at all times and never having the tank exposed, neither of these are an issue. Also the fabric tends to roll up a lot so I'm constantly having to pull it down. I won't be repurchasing, definitely not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: EB800

customer_reviews.title: Can't wear to work bc my boobs look weird but I love this bra for my days off and even sleeping ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfy but the girls are weirdly cone-shaped in this bra. More expensive than I wanted to spend but I thought this was THE bra so I bought it. Can't wear to work bc my boobs look weird but I love this bra for my days off and even sleeping in bc it's so comfy. For work days, I bought the Leading Ladies Padded Underwire Bra and I can't say enough great things about it AND it was only $25! A steal, especially for well endowed ladies like myself. I'm currently wearing a 36DDD which is obscene but the Leading Ladies gives support, comfort and tames these big girls for a busy day at work.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwanna

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, until...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bra in a medium while pregnant and LOVED IT! Postpartum I needed to go one side down, so I ordered one size down. It was a DRAMATIC difference from one size to the next. I am taking like a full 2 inches. Now I can't wear a medium or a small and have to buy something else. I am heartbroken because I loved this bra so much while I was pregnant.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: You have to have it.
customer_reviews.text: When I first pregnant some friends recommended Bravado to me. But I didn’t buy since it’s more expensive than Motherhood. When I was pregnant with my second baby, my breast became very sensitive that I can’t wear normal bras. Then I thought maybe I should give Bravado a try. I bought the cheapest kind through Amazon and now I have three Bravado bras. They are just so comfortable that my breasts feel even better than wearing nothing. Thank you Bravado!
customer_reviews.author: CGW

customer_reviews.title: So comfy
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bras! I have three now and they are by far my favorite. Very soft, super comfortable, and they fit so nicely! They fit true to size, but if your purchasing before your milk comes in I recommend going a size up, I ordered a medium fory first two and needed to add an extender for it to fit properly, I ordered a large and it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Great nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: It’s not the cutest bra but it’s functional as a nursing bra and very soft. My rib cage is particularly sensitive and I can’t wear a lot of different brands of bras but this one is soft enough that it doesn’t irritate me. Good material and the clips are easy to clip on and off especially when I’m doing it under my shirt one handed while holding a wiggly baby .
customer_reviews.author: aduh

customer_reviews.title: Design changed but still one of the best
customer_reviews.text: Some time in the past couple years it seems the design changed. I’ve been using these for 5+ years and through 3 kids. It seems like the most recent couple I purchased, I feel a bit more squished, sort of like a sports bra (and not because my size has changed). I think it’s probably more supportive now, it also has more hooks than the previous version. I might appreciate that once I’m back to work but right now I’m wearing them 24/7 at home and finding them to be less comfortable than in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Bras not bad, new pads will be needed
customer_reviews.text: It fits comfortably and offers full coverage. However, one major downfall is that the pads that come with it are absolutely terrible, they’re supper thin and WAY to small, so with some tee shirts you can see the outline around the front of my breasts which is unfortunate. I expected them to be similar to the Bravado! Designs seamless undershirt which I LOVE but they’re not even close. :/
customer_reviews.author: CorFamily

customer_reviews.title: I don't even want to try other bras
customer_reviews.text: I own probably 5 of these and I just adore them. They are stretchy enough that I can wear when I'm not pregnant! The colors are great and they are sturdy enough to hold up as a sports bra. So stretchy and comfortable with very firm support. These cost a bit of money but they are worth it. I hand wash mine and expect them to last for a very long time. This is the bra I recommend to all of my expecting friends.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Throm

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit for athletic build and terrible padding shape
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible fit for my athletic build. I have a strong upper body and while according to the size chart I should be a S, it was squeezing my armpits. The pads are also ridiculous - just circles (see pictures) that have too high a curvature so that they only cover about 70% of my boobs and make them look like Madonna's cone boobs or like a tube depending on where the pads sit. Even changing the pads did not fix the issues. Unfortunately I'll have to eat the $44 bc I missed the returns deadline. I gave 2 stars bc at least the fabric and the nursing hook mechanisms were were good quality.
customer_reviews.author: papayayaya

customer_reviews.title: Three stars
customer_reviews.text: I got this bra in the size that I normally wear. I was only 10 weeks along at the time and I am very small (and haven’t grown) so I didn’t think to get a size up for growth. It was tight even for my Norma size. I should have gotten a size or two up. The band was a little bit on the tight side and I had it on the very last latch. So I returned this one and bought a kindred bravely simply sublime nursing bra instead
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: While it lasted it was a very supportive nursing bra. I ordered this bra expecting it to be high quality due to it costing twice as much as my other nursing bras. However it has fallen apart within a month. The stitching on one of the clasps came apart (see photo). I am shocked at the poor quality. I only wear my nursing bras on the weekends to places a nursing tank is not appropriate. Therefore I got very few uses out of this bra before it came apart. I have other nursing bras (purchased from motherhood maternity) that lasted from breastfeeding my oldest son and I am still wearing. Save your money and purchase a nursing bra elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Runs large causing unflattering chest shape
customer_reviews.text: Material is really soft but fit was off. I was a 30C pre-pregnancy and am wearing a 32D/DD currently. I ordered a size small and there was tons of excess fabric and the pads made a very unflattering torpedo boob look. It’s almost comical how unflattering it is. I’m going to try a XS and hope less fabric will fix the torpedo boob.
customer_reviews.author: M8

customer_reviews.title: perfect nursing bra, worth the price tag!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit! I love love LOVE the fabric! This is comfortable for breasts that fluctuate in size throughout the day due to milk supply/feedings. I love the 4 clasps in the back for extra support (XXL size). I of course wish they were cheaper, but love these so much that I have 2 of them and would still spend the money for the quality. I wash frequently (they do not shrink up or lose their quality with washings), and will likely buy a third soon to cut down on how often I need to wash them.
customer_reviews.author: upperleft

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit
customer_reviews.text: Very soft material. The fit is PERFECT and I have had a very hard time finding nursing bras that actually fit. Most are sized S-XL, and since this one is sized by band and cup size, you get the perfect fit. It even has additional hook settings in the back to grow and shrink back as you're pregnant and postpartum. The closures open and close easily for nursing. It is extremely comfortable, even for all day wear. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JasonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: I just want to buy the same one but different color with last 2 times ,so I ordered this one ,but I need to return right now ,cause same size ,this one small than last time and not full cover bra ,and design still have a little bit different ,totally not what I want is .i already bought 2 pink color ,that pink color really good .
customer_reviews.author: Miya Sui

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable & supportive
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this bra! Super comfortable and supportive especially for a nursing mom! My only complaint is that the pad inserts fold all the time and I have to fix them almost every time after I feed my baby, which is a pain. I wish they were tracked or something so they didn't do that. Otherwise I love it! Best bra I've found in years!
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and not as seamless as thought
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking for a seamless design for all around every day use and this is well, falling short of feeling like a "normal" bra (but for nursing) for such a high price point. Maybe this is better for bustier women but I'm 5'4" and currently 124 pounds postpartum I got an XS and really not happy overall. I am sorry to say that I'm quickly replacing it in my wardrobe for more seamless options with daintier clips (the clips feel bulky) and would like a refund. There are smoother designs that just work instead of feeling like I have a weird compression thing going on. :/
customer_reviews.author: Elke S

customer_reviews.title: Great for nursing, NOT during pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bra prior to delivery as my breasts were getting larger and I wanted to get used to the bra style. I am typically a 36D and always wear a bra with an underwire. During pregnancy I did not like the feel of this bra as it does not offer the support I prefer. However when I began nursing and pumping this bra is amazing! It is comfortable, durable and easy to latch/unlatch. This unit also holds up well in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: the testers

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: This nursing bra is comfortable and just enough support. I got it early in pregnancy to see if I would like it and I do. I will get more as I grow. Only reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5 was because the bra arrived with only one pad in the cup and not two, which I thought was really odd and more then likely a misshap. I would recommend getting this bra. After a few months I will update my review on wheather it holds up or not.
customer_reviews.author: marcia

customer_reviews.title: The best nursing bra I've found yet.
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite nursing bras of all time. I've had 4 babies and am still nursing my youngest. These bras provide sufficient support, a nice shape, and I like that there are some nice colors to chose from. I like that I can undo the hook with one hand since I'm usually holding my baby with the other hand when I'm getting ready to nurse. I wash in the machine in a delicates bag, and then generally line dry, although sometimes I do machine dry on low temp. This bra is totally worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kellum

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I spent lots of $20 and $30 dollars for a lot of nursing bra (target, Walmart...) and no one fits me as good as Bravado. Pros: -it’s soft; -comfortable; -fit perfectly by size (I’m 34D) -the claps are very strong and easy to open and close. -the option for remove de pads -very supportive (I’m surprised) -great shape Cons: the price! Very expensive but for me worth every penny. I got one first and I love it, and now I have one more.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBug

customer_reviews.title: Love these bras!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite nursing bras. I am very large chested and these manage to give me decent support while keeping the tops of my breast from popping out. They are lighter weight than other lined bras, but they don't show through and they don't give your breasts and awkward shape. I wear them under everything. The quality is great as well. I have worn 2 of my bras after both of my pregnancies and they are still both in great shape. I would highly recommend this to any breastfeeding mom, especially those that have larger breasts. I wear a 34H/I and the medium works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Malorie

customer_reviews.title: Best Nursing Bra!
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my first and knew I had to buy it again for my second. The Bravado nursing bras are soft and comfortable, while being supportive and functional at the same time. It comes with a "conversion kit" to convert to a regular bra, but I have never used it since I like to go back to a regular bra once I stop nursing. The snaps are super easy to take off and on with one-hand, which is a must when you have a crying, hungry, and sometimes hangry baby! I recommend purchasing multiples!
customer_reviews.author: Matcha T.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great Nursing and Pregnancy Bra
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bra for not only nursing, but while you're pregnant. It's easy to use for nursing, is soft, comfortable, and supportive w/o having an underwire. Pregnant and nursing, I'm about a 36D...normally only a 36B. It lasted throughout my first baby and now I'm on to #2.
customer_reviews.author: Megan E. Mullin

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 4 nursing bras so far. This has been the best one for me. I have side boob I like support on and anything that is not wired usually lacks support in that area. This one has sufficient support in the sides. Quality looks good, color was as shown and size was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: P.Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually buy full coverage bras and only got this because it is recommended for use with Willow. However, I am ordering another one because it's the most comfortable and flattering maternity bra I have owned. It's worth the price. A+ for quality, fit and feel.
customer_reviews.author: ElEcho

customer_reviews.title: Great compromise between lift and gentle
customer_reviews.text: Favorite nursing bra so far. While softer and less lifting than traditional bras, it provides more support and snugness than the others while still being gentle and expanding. I bought a 3 pack of a similar looking kind for the same price which are comfortable but not nearly as effective. The snaps are good
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this bra; however, I only give it two stars because I bought two of these (very expensive) bras when several months ago in preparation for my daughter. After I had my baby I started wearing these and within the first two weeks, a clasp on BOTH of my bras broke and deformed. My daughter is 10 weeks old now and I am still managing to wear one of these bras but the other one would randomly come completely undone throughout the day so I stopped wearing it. Needless to say I am very disappointed in this bra.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Grider

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but the hooks won't make it through a few washes
customer_reviews.text: I am very bummed to write this review because the bra is incredibly comfortable. It doesn't irritate me like other nursing bras but I've washed it about 4-5 times now and the hooks have completely become bent out of shape and not easily fixable. This wasn't a cheap purchase considering a nursing bra is planned to be used for a temporary amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Desai

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This bra was recommended to me by a LC. After trying 3 other bras this one was finally comfortable. The stretchy material is soft and gentle on sensitive breasts, esp after breastfeeding and pumping. Provides decent support (was a C prepregnancy, now up to a DD). I ordered a size large. It also provides great coverage without being overwhelming. My only complaint is that the band was too tight, I had to add an extender on the back to make it fit comfortably. I did try the next size up but the cups were way too big, so I kept the large and just added the extender on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kochanowicz

customer_reviews.title: Fits really well, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this bra and own three of them. They fit true to size (but definitely get new measurements, since I went up a full cup size once I got pregnant). My favorite things are that the bra shapes my boobs nicely even without the padding, and the back of this bra doesn't create weird back fat lines. I like this bra better than any of my other bras, including the regular ones!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Nude Color Different than Others :(
customer_reviews.text: I have this bra in three colors. The nude color is terrible - the elastic is sloppy and not at all supportive. The two other colors - two different pinks - are great! They are supportive and have lasted well. I have washed all three according to instructions so I don’t know what happened or if I just got a fluke. Either way, buy the pink ones!
customer_reviews.author: Katharine

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for nursing or expectant mothers
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Has removable cups that provide extra comfort and provide a nice silhouette under clothing. Suggest removing cups before washing otherwise they tend to fold and get wrinkled inside the bra. Plus it dries quicker that way, too. Used as maternity bra, too since bras with wire components would dig into my rib cage. Convenient for pumping once back to work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Grazy

customer_reviews.title: I'm very impressed and best of all the small size hooked on the tightest ...
customer_reviews.text: With my first baby I had such a hard time finding a nursing bra that would fit that I ended up getting a nursing sports bra. Needless to say, it did not work out. I just received this bra and it is so darn comfy!!! I'm very impressed and best of all the small size hooked on the tightest hook fits my 32A self very well. The only down side I could see potentially is the bra does come up kind of high. I couldn't see it being worn with anything that was strappy or lower cut
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this bra, this is my second time purchasing it. Old one lasted through three years of breastfeeding plus being worn near the end of all my pregnancies. Always washed and dried it in the machine and it's only now finally starting to get too stretched out. Very comfortable to wear, doesn't leave unsightly seam lines under my clothes, gives decent support for an underwire-less bra, and it's easy to unclasp/clasp one handed for feeding. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not flattering
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't provide a flattering shape of the chest. I like my other ones from Motherhood Maternity better Update: after a few months of use, the strap had loosen to a point where it keeps falling off my shoulders. Can't tighten the strap because the point at which the front piece latches on would be too far off the back.
customer_reviews.author: IzzyNichi

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bra - & my body is picky
customer_reviews.text: My favorite bra! This is the only nursing bra I wear, I’ve gotten it in a few colors. My body tends to be super picky about clothing, especially bras, so I am super grateful to have found one that my body tolerates so incredibly well. Although I would love to have some thing that’s made from a more natural material, I’m just glad to have found something I can wear. Highly recommend for those seeking something comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stack

customer_reviews.title: One month in, already fraying apart
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, I’m really disappointed in the quality. I bought this just over a month ago, and despite care taken while washing the bra is fraying and falling apart. I’ve always used a mesh bag, on gentle cycle and I hang dry; it started fraying almost immediately. I’ve attached a picture. Maybe I got a defective item, but regardless the straps that do not snap off are very very thin and made with material that doesn’t feel like it would last.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime_Ranay

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this purchase! I purchased it to take it with me to the hospital for post-delivery feeding, something I wish I would have done with my first child. This bra is extremely comfortable and offers great support. I've literally been living in this since the birth of my son. I HATE wearing a bra in general but with leaky heavy boobs it's kind of a must, but this is a game changer. It's pricey but totally worth it. Highly recommend for all breastfeeding moms. Last thing, I did find that it runs small, but easy there are easy returns with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL!!
customer_reviews.text: The material was soft and felt nice, sure, but the bra wouldn't even clasp behind me. I wear a 36C and I ordered the M according to the chart. I lengthened the straps all the way out and the bra was too high. I tried to pull it down and clasp it behind me and the clasps wouldnt even touch. It was like a junior M size ... Word of advice, SIZE UP!
customer_reviews.author: The Jenkies

customer_reviews.title: Supportive nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: I tried many nursing bras and this one was the most comfortable and also supportive. The only thing I don't like is that sometimes you can see the padding inside the cups depending on how it is placed within the bra.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best, but one of the only nursing bras that had a large enough cup(H). The band wasn’t big enough but it works with an extender. The worst thing is that the fabric is rigid, but I’m hoping it will soften after a few washes.
customer_reviews.author: Persephika

customer_reviews.title: The perfect nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: I had three of these bras and left all three at my parent's house after visiting them. In desperation I went and got another nursing bra until I could get those back and it made me realize how truly amazing this bravado nursing bra really is. They have such wonderful support, are incredibly comfortable, and make nursing an absolute breeze. I love them so much I ordered a 4th so I hopefully never have to go without one again!
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: ... week of pregnancy as I was seeking a more comfortable bra that could carry me over to use when ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in my 25th week of pregnancy as I was seeking a more comfortable bra that could carry me over to use when my new baby is here. It is definitely comfortable, but provides moderate support for my 36DD chest. I purchased a large per the size chart, but would say if my chest grew any larger at all, I am borderline needing an XL. Looking forward to using this for nursing in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, durable, well fitted.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bras, ordered 3rd one. It is a bit pricey, but in my opinion worth it. It held up well with washes/daily use. I do not want to wear any other bra since I found these. It does have a removable pad, but unlike some other brands I have used, it does not give your breasts weird shape and is truly indistinguishable from how regular bra would look under clothes. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Currently 8 months pregnant and so glad I made the early switch to a nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: Currently 8 months pregnant and so glad I made the early switch to a nursing bra. This has been a welcome addition to my maternity wardrobe. So much gentler on my skin and forgiving on my expanding ribs. Clips do not snap open unexpectedly as it does with other cheaper brands. I have also found that the removable cups stay in place and don't bunch/look like "nipple issues" as they do with a cheaper nursing bra I have. Bravado is worth the extra cost for the comfort and functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing bra ever!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this nursing bra. The only ones I've worn this time around. Incredibly comfortable, good nipple coverage, looks smooth and shapely under tee-shirts even without an underwire. Very good support (32D). It does have full coverage, so can't wear an especially deep v neck or extra low cut shirt. Never had a problem with it. The only minor annoyance is occasionally the elastic that holds it together when unclipped sticks out the armpit - just make sure to tuck it in after nursing. Best nursing bra ever. So comfy, I'm considering using the included kit to make it into a regular bra after I'm done breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: t mueller

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: If you love having a uni-boob with no support than this is the bra for you! I wanted to love this bra because so many people love it, it had such good reviews and every google search I did on nursing bras said this was the best. I hate it. I don't wear it unless it's the last resort. There is no support at all. I am left with a uni-boob look, no lift or separation at all. This in not a look I like. I'm not huge, 38D, but I do like some support. Wish I could sent it back because it was kinda expensive, but it's too late for that now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and holds up.
customer_reviews.text: Tried one too many nursing bras in my time and this is the most comfortable and easy to use. I like that the whole bra front comes down instead of just a hole for your nipple like some bras. Run a little small but stretch out a bit over time. Have had two for 5 years. Used with my first and now second.
customer_reviews.author: Dianamkat

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: The only nursing bra i continuously wear Over and over because of the support when my breasts are sore and heavy. And the clips are easy to button and unbutton with a constant hungry baby. Worth the investment!!
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this bra, it’s more comfortable then my other nursing bras but I followed their sizing and ordered a medium (I’m a 32DDD/G) and it fit ok at first a little big in the band but now is stretched out and it so longer supportive. It’s only been 2 months so I’m disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Near

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a large but I’m normally an A cup (before breastfeeding) so I maybe get to a C but that sizing still seems off. I don’t like this bra, it makes my boobs look pointy and it’s hard to unclip with one hand. I find myself reaching for the Bravado sports bra that they sell, it’s way better!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, weird boob shape
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this bra and use it a lot! The quality is great and the fabric is soft. The ONLY thing I don't like is that it has this breast pouch. Instead of having a full breast cup, it has this centered area for your boob to go in. (That was a terrible description, I tried) It's not an issue for me since I don't have large breast. But I would imagine that if I did, It would cause my breast to hang over or look pointy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable nursing bra that I own
customer_reviews.text: The pros: Ultra comfortable and does not leave chaffing on the side of the boob (like my other bras) Super-adjustable -- I think it has six hook settings (as opposed to the usual 3) Decent support, considering it is not an underwire Each cup opens fully when whipping out a boob Removable, washable pads that really do prevent leakage from spilling all over your shirt The cons: Yes, it looks like a granny bra (especially the nude colors, like butterscotch -- oh! could there be a more old lady-ish name for the color of a bra than butterscotch?!) You must rotate it with another bra -- after a day of wear, it will be stretched out a bit
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this bra every other day for the past 15 months and it shows very little signs of wear. It is very comfortable, durable and works well for nursing. My only frustration is that the padding is not sewn in place so every time I wash it, I have to unfold and / or move the pads to go over my breasts again. Not a big issue, though, I would still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher in Washington

customer_reviews.title: My absolute favorite nursing bra - great for bigger boobs needing more support.
customer_reviews.text: Great supportive bra, have worn through two babies and still going strong. The material is really nice and thick so it doesn't stretch out and doesn't show your nipples as easily. I bought the bravado bras like this from Target and they are NOT the same - spend a little extra for this bra, it is well worth the money! Will be buying this one again if anything ever happens to the one I already have :) So far after heavy wear and washing, it's in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wadleigh

customer_reviews.title: According to Pregnant Wife: All Day Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my pregnant wife. We tried buying a few highly customer rated products to see which she liked best. Out of the 3 we tried, this one was the best (according to her!). The other two we tried are below: This one was her least favorite, says its uncomfortable to wear all day: This is her second best, which she can wear comfortably all day: The Bravado was also the most expensive. Go figure, but whatever is comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: James N.

customer_reviews.title: Fits large
customer_reviews.text: I have a large chest when not nursing, so right now (3 weeks PP), my breasts are huge! I normally wear a 42DD, but right now I am measuring 42G, so I ordered the 2XL based on the size chart and on my experience with other Bravado! bras and tanks. Iwhile the cuo size is perfect, the band size is too big and with the heft of my breasts the back of the bra constantly rides up my back quickly becomes uncomfortable. I am constantly readjusting and usually end up stripping the bra off within a couple of hours. Alas, the search continues for a comfortable and supportive nursing bra for my large chest...
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Great nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: Great nursing bra! It fits well, is very comfortable and can be converted to a "normal" bra when your finished nursing. This is the bra that was recommended (and the only style sold) by my nursing consultant and hospital. It was cheaper to order the bra off of amazon then to purchase it through them. My only complaint is that on me, the bra comes up a little high in the middle. This means that you can see the bra when I wear some shirts. A mild inconvenience - but when you're nursing your wardrobe is a limited to begin with so it's annoying that there are even more shirts that I can't wear because of the bra.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Benetka

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I'll be the first to admit that when shopping for nursing bras I bought several from destination maternity/pea in the pod that were pretty and stylish looking. They were reasonable comfortable pre-delivery too. This bra though has been hands down my favorite post-delivery and I have ordered four in total. It is supportive without being constrictive. Other bras I was wearing had smaller bands around the torso and ultimately cut off my milk supply. I can't praise these enough. New moms may be shocked at how quickly you end up leaking through a bra and needing to change so buy several bras so you're not doing laundry all the time and use breast pads.
customer_reviews.author: Mjonesy

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for Moms
customer_reviews.text: The bra is awesome for nursing. Super comfortable to wear. Works very well under thinner fabrics (i.e. t-shirts). Not the most flattering appearance, but it's underwear who's going to judge other than you or your spouse? Didn't give a perfect rating for two reasons, the fabric and the price. The fabric is a type that you feel like a hangnail might catch and run. You won't, but it feels like it. As for the price, it's a bit steep for what you get. I would buy multiple if the price weren't so high, but you are getting a great quality option.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lachapelle

customer_reviews.title: Favorite nursing bra ever!
customer_reviews.text: Take it from a mom-of-many that used to buy the cheap ones; I would never go back. I discovered these at our hospital lactation store and at their advice invested in two of them. They aren't the most romantic looking, but they are the most comfortable and no worries about seeing nursing pads or anything through thinner shirts. Once your milk comes in and you don't have as much trouble with leaking, you can use the washable inserts with this bra and just wash rather than purchase other pads. Can also convert to a regular bra when you are finished nursing. Gave one as a gift to a new mom who also loves it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bra, but size chart was not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel and support of this bra. Once I put it on, I did not want to take it off! I initially ordered a Large because according to the size chart on here, that's what I should be...but I was spilling out of the sides and the back was too tight. I returned it (for free) and got an XL and it fits perfectly. Would definitely recommend! I'll be buying in a few other colors since I love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: ANGiac

customer_reviews.title: Great support, excellent quality! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: The first bra I ordered was a bit small but I could tell the material was excellent quality so I ordered a size bigger and LOVED IT! I spent 8 months nursing not knowing about this bra and I feel like I missed out. Definitely worth the money if you want a supportive nursing bra that will hold up and you can wear anywhere. My others were good as sleep bras but not very supportive, this does both great. Also, the pads stay in place really well and do not show through clothes. I ended up ordering another I loved it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I will definitely be buying another one of these! Pregnancy and weight gain combined upped my band size to a 40-42, which seems to be impossible to find in stores anywhere. I was hesitant to spend so much money on a bra that I was ordering online and unable to try on first, but the sizing chart seems to be quite accurate! This is the first bra in months that I can wear without putting an extender on the strap! It's super comfortable and supportive. I also found it easy to latch back together after nursing- no different than other nursing bra or tank latches I have used. It is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Music Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bra!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bra, especially for the very early days of nursing (when your body is adjusting to nursing and your breasts are uncomfortable/fluctuating in size). It gives you a nice shape without looking matronly. It is very comfortable, and good quality - it has been through my washer several times on the delicates cycle in a lingerie bag. It fit true to size using the size chart provided by Bravado. I ended up buying 3, which is the perfect number for an everyday nursing bra.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this bra based on all of the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this bra based on all of the reviews. I followed the sizing guide from the manufacturer's website, and the band was still far too small for me when I tried it on. I have band extenders, so tried it on with that, and still had fit issues with the molded cups. One side looked ok but not great, and the other side just looked terrible - you could see the entire outline of the cup. Overall, the bra didn't seem like it would be enough support for me even without the fit issues. I returned this and will be trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: The best bra which I have had during pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I have changed 4 bras during pregnancy. Three of them were uncomfortable. The fourth one was ok. The fifth was Bravado body silk. And this one is the best for several reasons. First, even though there is no wire, it provides sufficient support. Having size 36C, I could not find before wire free bra with good support. Underwire bras are not recommended during breastfeeding period. Second, the bra stretches and fits to different sizes. Basically, you may buy only this one bra for the pregnancy and breastfeeding period and it will stretch with your growing breast. Third, it has removable cups which hide the nipples and may be used as breast pads. Strongly recommend this bra!
customer_reviews.author: oxana

customer_reviews.title: 32F(US) is in between sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have previous models of this bra from previous babies in a size small, so I ordered a small and a medium since I measured 32F and the chart says I need a medium. The medium was much too large; I had to hook it on the tightest setting which left it no room to stretch out, and the cup was digging into to my armpit. However, the small is much too tight and I can barely get it on the loosest hooks. Apparently 32F is in between sizes, so I will be using an extender.
customer_reviews.author: mamabird005

customer_reviews.title: Best bra ever
customer_reviews.text: Best bra ever. Doesn't even feel like I'm wearing a bra! I have two and have worn them every single day for almost two years now, and they're still in decent shape. The only thing I've sometimes had issues with is that they don't work for low-cut shirts. (My shirts aren't even THAT low, but sometimes my bra shows while wearing a v-neck. I'm a B cup.) Also, finally after two years of wear the clasps on the back are starting to fall apart. Highly, highly recommend. I'm even thinking of purchasing them again, even though I'm not nursing!
customer_reviews.author: AJones

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Coconut shell boobs!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bra while pregnant to use while nursing postpartum. I had heard good reviews about it, so was hopeful, but it didn't work out. The bra itself seems well made and worked fine, but boy did it give me some coconut shell boobs! They created an awkwardly round shape that didn't look natural at all. Not sure if this was just how it fit on me, or is universal, but it just didn't look right, so I returned it. (For reference, I'm a 34C and bought the medium)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: best nursing bra
customer_reviews.text: after I received this bra in an order containing 4 different nursing bras, I can easily say, "you get what you pay for." This was the most expensive bra I ordered and all the other "less expensive" bras are getting returned. I'd rather have 2 Bravado nursing bras than 6 generic, cheap nursing bras. The material is stretchy and forgiving, with a wide band around the sides that doesn't give me the "back rolls" that other bras do. This is truly a bra that will grow with you...buy one as soon as your regular bra gets uncomfortable during your pregnancy. You might as well use it as long as you can. I wish I had bough these sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: The only bra you will need
customer_reviews.text: I have at least 5 of these. I tell all of the expecting mothers I know about these bra's. I have even given them as gifts a few times. Even when you are done with breastfeeding, these are great. There is a retro kit they send along with the bra to use when you are through breastfeeding, but you don't really need it. The hooks stay closed very well and I have never had one come open by accident. My oldest turns 5 this week and I still have the first one of these I bought. They last forever if you take good care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer & Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good bra while breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: I got my usual size but it was a bit snug so I also got the next size up. It fits comfortably enough for work but the removable leak pads can shift at times and get lost in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon Dubinsky

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bra is SO comfy! I’ve been searching for a good nursing bra and am so glad my friend recommended this one. I am normally a 38C and the XL fits me like a glove. The removable cups aren’t weirdly shaped or lumpy like I’ve found in other nursing bras. The thick material also gives great lift and support while still being comfortable and stretchy. And I love that the back has a thick band so it smooths everything out instead of digging in. All around awesome bra and totally worth the price!! I will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A+ product
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to purchase due to the price but I decided to go for it and I am so glad I did. This bra is so comfortable that I ordered a second one. I wear it all the time, even to bed. The cups are slightly molded so they provide some shape under clothing but not stiff or uncomfortable. They unclip and fold down when nursing or pumping. The strap is a little loose when you unclip, which was strange at first but now I find it very comfortable as it helps to get the cup out of the way for your little one's ease of access. Great job on the design, Bravado!
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: The bra is really soft and nice to the skin
customer_reviews.text: The bra is really soft and nice to the skin. It looks like it’s well made. I got size M and I’m 38 B. Giving it 4 stars because if the shape of this bra( you can’t really wear a lot of clothes with it unless you don’t wear deep cut t-shirts) plus the padding inserts make my breast look weird!
customer_reviews.author: Yulia Holthaus

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS. Can't express that enough. I've had another one from this same company, that I didn't love nearly as much. This is SO comfortable, gives great shape without being bulky, holds shape, holds up in the washer, and easy to clip and un-clip quickly. I'm not usually a fan of the wide snap band in the back, but it hasn't bothered me. One of the clips broke off in the back after only a couple wears, which is annoying, but fixable with a needle and thread. Do not waste your money on a cheapy nursing bra. Really!! Best money I've spent in a while. Will be buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Those were good, so I thought
customer_reviews.text: My God. So Ive now realized I've been suffering this whole time. I couldn't bring myself to spend $50 on a nursing bra. So I went with the very highly rated ones on Amazon that were half the price. Those were good, so I thought, until I put on this magical bra. My boibs are mad at me for having doesn't all the time in the other bras. I'm not sure what it is but this bra feels like freaking heaven. I'm about to drop some serious moola for more of these. It's amazing. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the nursing mom
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought this bra fit way too small. I'm a 34B and got a medium and it felt extremely tight. However, it stretches out a bit and the snug fit provides the needed support when you're nursing. The clips took a few tries to figure out but once you get the hang of it it's easy to use even when you're bleary-eyed in the middle of the night! The Lanisoh nursing pads fit perfectly inside. Once I tried this bra, I got several in different colours so that I always have a clean one on hand since they often get soiled with baby's drool or breast milk. I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Iheartamazon

customer_reviews.title: THE bra
customer_reviews.text: As a small chested woman it’s always a struggle to find nursing bras. This is IT! Yes it’s a higher price range than many, but it’s so worth it. Completely comfortable, great colors, high quality, keeps its shape, washes well, I can wear it(probably longer than I’m supposed to) without it getting stretched out... it’s perfect. I purchased an XS, I’m a 32A pre pregnancy and wind up around a 34B/C and every fluctuating size in between while nursing...
customer_reviews.author: Scott&Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Best Nursing Bra Ever!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best fitting and most comfortable nursing bras out there that I've tried on! I can sleep in it and wear it all day long because it has no wires. Who has time for wires when you're nursing!? It comes with insertable pads but I never use it as it creates too much bulk and moves around too much. I have this in black also. My advice is don't go cheap on your nursing bras because you'll be living in it 24/7 and there's a lot of wear that happens. Bravado is my "go-to" nursing brand because of the comfort, fit, & quality.
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little stumped as to the rave reviews. Yes, this bra is comfortable, but it offers very little support and the side straps under the pull-down cups stretch out a TON! I bought this bra on two different colors and the straps on both are so stretched out that they just dangle by my armpits. There is no way to adjust these. I don't even know how they would get stretched out, and I've only been wearing for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: frazier.simpson

customer_reviews.title: ... are ok- I’m a 38DDD while nursing and was recommended these bras by a friend who is also big ...
customer_reviews.text: These bras are ok- I’m a 38DDD while nursing and was recommended these bras by a friend who is also big busted. They do the job as far as sleep bras go. I couldn’t give it 5 stars bc it causes uniboob and they sagged below the bra band. Tried a couple of different sizes to see if it would fix it. It didn’t. Heard these are great for smaller breasted women. I recommend them for nighttime but definitely not during the day/outside the house!
customer_reviews.author: blondie99

customer_reviews.title: The only nursing bra you need
customer_reviews.text: I saw many good reviews for this bra and hesitantly decided to give it a try because I am large chested. I am so glad I got this that I got another one already. I have been breastfeeding for 5 months now and any other bra I have tried doesn't compare. My boobs stay in place and lifted! I'm somewhere in the range of 38-40 DDD, hard to know for sure because of nursing. As someone that always used underwire bras before breastfeeding, I didn't think it was possible to have a stretchy bra that worked so well. Definitely would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Shara

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing bra ever.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so thankful my friends told me about Bravado! After sharing my horrifying experience paying too much for a hideous bra at the mall, cool mom friends told me they love their Bravado bras. I was excited to see the reasonable pricing, and even more excited about how comfortable and functional these bras are. The Body Silk is so comfortable, I need more. I love that it looks like a camisole, so I don't mind if it shows sometimes. The butterscotch color is perfect for no-showing under light tops on my medium complexion. So comfortable and soft, it's my first choice when grabbing a bra, and sometimes I even sleep in it. Get one, maybe two.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: No support, horrible contraption.
customer_reviews.text: If you're overweight this bra will not fit well. It does not stay in place, it either rides up my back or sags in the front, so I usually have no bust support and a horrible backache, and I'm barely a C cup! The strap that connects the front piece to the shoulder strap is fraying and just a few days away from coming apart completely and I've only had the bra under 6 months! For the price, I expected better. For the plethora of awesome reviews, I expected better. This bra is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: An above-average product
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, comfortable. If anything, it's a tad on the small size (though I think I am probably right between sizes). At a 38 DD (pre-pregnancy), I went with a Large, per the company's sizing chart. It fits for now, but I've ordered an XL to wear later on. Amazon's shipping was very slow: Ordered May 26 and received it June 3. Ordered another one (cheaper!) on eBay and it showed up two days later! Another note: this bra is very similar to the seamless clip down nursing bra at Motherhood, which sells for about $27, so if you need a cheaper option, that's a good alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia F.

customer_reviews.title: Love this bra
customer_reviews.text: I love this bra. I'm normally a size 36 D/DD pre-pregnancy, and found that the XL of this bra fit the best. With the large, I still had issues of side boob coming out the top, but the XL fully covers and doesn't leave you with a sports bra uniboob look. With a bra like this you're not going to have the same lift and separate support as you would with an underwire bra, but for wire free this bra does a really good job, not to mention it's extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Neen

customer_reviews.title: BEST NURSING BRA EVER
customer_reviews.text: BEST NURSING BRA EVER! Dont waste your time or money on anything else, this bra is comfortable and looks great under shirts, it hides nursing pads well so you don't look lumpy. Also if you forget a pad, they have a thicker cup so you aren't going to soak your shirt right away. My only complaint is that they seem to stretch out sooner than I'd like (But I've been nursing or pregnant for the last 3 years, so I've put mine through heavy use.) I'd recommend going a size smaller than you think you need and plan to wear it on the largest setting at first, then as it stretches you can wear it on the next loops.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Nursing Bra!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had multiple sets of Motherhood bras for my first 4 kids, and after my last set wore out, I needed some new bras. After searching and searching, trying on every kind of bra, my sister recommended the Bravado bra. I was hesitant to buy these bras because they were expensive. I have been wearing them for 3 months, and they are SO WORTH IT!!! These are so much more comfortable than the Motherhood bras!! I wish I would have found theseyears ago!!! They are the most comfortable bras I have worn, nursing or not. They also convert to a regular bra, and come with the hardware to do so. I will be wearing these from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Military Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bra!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bra!! I feel like I finally have a figure after six months pp. I'm supported and comfort. I purchased an XL, the band is nice and thick, and the shoulder straps are also wide and very comfortable. The cup provides so much support and also helps you control how much you show while pumping or nursing. Silky smooth material with moisture wicking quality. Overall a fantastic bra!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best nursing bra even for DDDs.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite nursing bra. For reference I am 32DD pre-preg and 34 DDD post preg. I ordered a large at first and it fits fine. I needed a looser fit when I first started nursing due to oversupply engorgement and soreness. Now that my supply has regulated a medium fits perfect. I can still get away with wearing my large. My reference points are the braverly Terry bra and a Freya wired nursing bra. This Bravado bra provides most comfortable support and I can sleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: Familia Hernandez

product_meta.title: BRAVADO! DESIGNS Women's Body Silk Seamless Nursing Bra and Maternity Bra, XS – XXL and Full Cups (A to J Cups)
product_meta.description: The Body Silk Seamless Nursing Bra provides you with a luxuriously comfortable seamless experience. It is a great maternity and nursing bra choice for every day, at-home, on-the-go or simply anytime. The super soft fabric molds to your changing shape, so that you can wear it from maternity to nursing and beyond. Features wide size range to accommodate all moms, including small, busty and plus sizes. All Bravado Designs nursing bras have our proprietary, easy open and close, one-handed bravado designs 'B' nursing clips. In addition, the full drop-away cup design allows for maximum skin-to-skin contact. A bra conversion kit is included so you can convert your nursing bra to a 'regular bra' once your nursing journey is complete. All Bravado Designs styles are tested and certified in accordance with Standard 100 by Oeko-Tex requirements, which ensures products are free from harmful substances.
feature_bullets: MOM’S CHOICE AWARD WINNER: this luxuriously soft, wire-free and seamless nursing bra provides added comfort during pregnancy and breastfeeding
4-WAY STRETCH FABRIC hugs your changing shape, making it the perfect bra for maternity and nursing
MOLDED CUPS AND REMOVABLE FOAM INSERTS provide shape, separation and discretion while nursing. Full drop-away cups provide maximum skin-to-skin contact for breastfeeding

FULL CUP SIZES: knit-in zones around the cups and optimized construction to provide extra lift and support for larger busts and smaller bands; larger foam cups for better shape and breast support; ideal inner sling shape for lift and support
For better fit, see Bravado's size chart image in the product details. Available in SIZES XS TO 2XL, and in FULL CUP SIZES FROM M-FC TO XL-FC. Sizes range from A to J Cups
